citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, it was noted that a small cynomolgus macaque was observed in its secondary containment area.
Area employees responded, per their written protocol, to capture and return the animal to its primary enclosure.
Animals that escape their enclosure may be subjected to injury, trauma, and undue stress.
Housing facilities for nonhuman primates must protect the animal from injury, contain the animals securely, and restrict
other animals from entering. Corrected at the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Charles Palmer, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.75(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
At the time of inspection, it was noted that a small cynomolgus macaque was observed in its secondary containment area. 
Area employees responded, per their written protocol, to capture and return the animal to its primary enclosure. 
 
Animals that escape their enclosure may be subjected to injury, trauma, and undue stress. 
 
Housing facilities for nonhuman primates must protect the animal from injury, contain the animals securely, and restrict 
other animals from entering. Corrected at the time of inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Charles Palmer, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
